title: West Town Shooting Wounds 4 Men, Police Say
content:
CHICAGO — A shooting in West Town left four men wounded early Saturday, police said.
At 3:30 a.m., the men were in the 100 block of North Seeley Avenue when they were shot, police said.
A 21-year-old man was hit in his right ankle, a 34-year-old man was hit in his legs, a 36-year-old man was hit in his right leg and a 39-year-old man was hit in his right leg, police said. They were taken to Stroger Hospital in good condition.
Officers found a gun at the scene. The victims have been uncooperative, police said, and the circumstances of the shooting are being investigated.
No one was in custody.
